results.title: Trouble in Paradise
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Many people would regard Switzerland as an earthly paradise. Why is it then that young people have been rioting in Zurich? Jack Pizzey examines the theory that the price the Swiss pay for their affluence is a sham democracy where the real power lies with big business and that the country’s image of Red Cross altruism hides ruthless exploitation of the Third World.

results.title: The Biggest epidemic of our times. Pt. 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
The second of two programs in which doctors, police and accident investigation teams powerfully demonstrate the need for greater care on the roads. This episode focuses on the problems of motorcyclists and the safety regulations of helmets.

results.title: VD: who cares?
results.creator_credit: Harry Weisbloom and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”
VD has become the second highest notifiable disease after measles, and it is spreading among the young. Some people are beginning to ask - is this epidemic the price of the permissive society? Interviews patients and doctors at the clinics to discover how an under-resourced and outdated part of the National Health Service is coping with the situation.

results.title: The Work of the World Health Organisation
results.creator_credit: Janine Hamel-Minne, United Nations and World Health Organisation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Traces the history of the World Health Organisation from early attempts to develop an international program for prevention of epidemics to the current promotion of health. Also gives an overall view of the work and activities of the Organisation.

results.title: Marriage under stress: Breaking point
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
What are the pressures that bring a marriage to the brink of disaster, that force a couple to consider a future apart from each other? Its is not always “The other woman” and it does not necessarily happen in the seventh year of marriage. This programme examines marriages which are pivoted between break-up and recovery.

results.title: Day by day
results.creator_credit: Robin James, ABC-TV (Australia) and Griffith University
results.brief_description: We look at some of the daily activities of the Chinese inhabitants of Beijing, beginning with Tai Chi exercises in the morning. Highlights work work, school, peasant farmers in a collective near Beijing, lunchtime, Children’s palaces where children may indulge in extra-curricular activities in sport and the arts, and Sunday visits to the park and the Forbidden City. Professor Colin Mackerras explains the history of calligraphy, and the ways in which the Chinese spend their time. Two dramatised segments show a grandfather sitting in the park and a family quarrel.

results.title: The Biggest epidemic of our times. Pt. 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
The first of two programs in which doctors, police and accident investigation teams powerfully demonstrate the need for greater care on the roads. This episode presents the statistics on British road accidents and discusses the legislation on seat belts.

results.title: Jailhouse shock
results.creator_credit: Ivor Dunkerton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
In New Jersey State Prison, a group of hardened inmates conduct a program in which young offenders on probation are confronted with the horrors of prison life - homosexual rape, murder, suicide, etc. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: My parents don't understand me
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Kathy Westen ran away from home at sixteen, was found six months later living rough, sleeping in derelict houses. Now she is at home again - at least for the time being. She left because she could not make her parents understand her. They worried because they could not understand what she was trying to tell them. Kathy’s act of throwing away the comforts and securities of home life represents the communication gulf between parents and their children today.

results.title: Dawn of the dead (Uncut version) [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: George A. Romero, Richard Rubinstein and Laurel Group Productions
results.brief_description: In this sequel to George Romero’s “Night of the living dead”, the US is engulfed and decimated by a zombie population growing at an inexplicable and alarming rate. Two Philadelphia police S.W.A.T. officers, a helicopter pilot and his TV reporter girlfriend escape the city and take refuge in an abandoned suburban shopping mall. Their attempts to isolate themselves from the marauding army of the undead are thwarted after a band of looters leave a door open allowing the zombies free access to the mall. Romero capitalises on the shopping mall location to present an apocalyptic allegory for a rampant consumer culture driven to eat itself by its own insatiable appetite. Cast includes David Emge, Ken Foree, Scott H. Reininger. Music by Dario Argento.
